meanings.definition: Evoking an idea or feeling in a subtle way.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious music was suggestive of a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was so suggestive of happiness.
meanings.sent3: The cat's suggestive meow made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in suggestive hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The old book had a suggestive smell of history and adventure.

meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were suggestive of an incoming storm.
meanings.sent2: His raised eyebrow was very suggestive of doubt.
meanings.sent3: The broken umbrella was quite suggestive of the rainy weather.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was suggestive of an impending announcement.
meanings.sent5: The map's dotted lines were suggestive of hidden paths in the forest.

meanings.sent1: The unfinished painting was suggestive of a work in progress.
meanings.sent2: His vague response was quite suggestive of uncertainty.
meanings.sent3: The empty plate was suggestive of a delicious meal that was once there.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of laughter was suggestive of a joyful gathering.
meanings.sent5: The scattered papers were suggestive of a busy day at work.
